website_summaries.verdict: Warm yet stylish women's boots for extreme weather.
pros: Seam-sealed waterproof construction and stylish leather with faux fur accents
Heavily insulated against freezing conditions and wet winter weather
cons: Many users were happy ordering a full size larger

customer_reviews.title: Difficult to put on
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to love these boots. They are adorable, and great quality. However, it was next to impossible to put them on without completely unlacing them, and then wrestling my foot into them. The calf/shaft of the boot was plenty wide. However the space at the ankle into the foot was too small. I had to twist the boot sideways to get them on. I don't have huge feet (size 8), but maybe someone with a size 6 or 7 would have better luck with these boots. They really are great quality, and I wanted to love them. But I also don't want a workout each time I want to wear these boots! :)
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable, Warm, Cute!
customer_reviews.text: I love them! I live in Minnesota and these are perfect for the cold weather. I've worn them several times for long hours, my feet have been comfortable and warm the whole time! I would totally buy these again!
customer_reviews.author: Rebekah

customer_reviews.title: POOR QUALITY
customer_reviews.text: The boots aren't really that warm and they are very heavy! In addition to that, the snaps on the outside that connect the inside boot to outside, broke. This is my second pair that have broke in the same way. The laces are also ripping; Called Sorel and sent pics. The warranty company tells me there is nothing they can do because it's been a year. I argued the boots have only been warn 3-5 times max and briefly because it doesn't snow that frequently in my area. They REFUSED to even repair them! Crappy boots with crappy customer service. Don't waste your money!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: MCS

customer_reviews.title: They looked so pretty online and when we got them but the country ...
customer_reviews.text: They looked so pretty online and when we got them but the country of origin has a different size foot then US. Could not get my foot in them and they said my size, was very disappointed. Not at the boot but the size, I really wanted them but the next sizes up weren't there anymore. Sad face. Gave them a 3 because they looked well made and very pretty but didn't get a chance to give them a run while on vacation in Iceland.
customer_reviews.author: Sugarplum

customer_reviews.title: Warm & adorable
customer_reviews.text: I read all the reviews before purchasing. I bought them in my normal size. At first they felt a bit tight around the toes but have since stretched nicely. Also, the back part everyone complained about jabbing into the leg did happen. But, I've been wearing them with jeans (over the part that hits) to run errands & around the house for the past week and they feel great now. They *do* feel like wearing clown shoes like others said. But my other rain boots feel similar - just not as heavy. All in all these are warm, super cute & will be perfect for Virginia winters & snow.
customer_reviews.author: Christy Jackson

customer_reviews.title: Snugness isn't good in winter boots
customer_reviews.text: I wear an 8 in most shoes. Although I do wear a 7.5 in western boots and a 9 in Nike running shoes. I bought these in a 8.5 and they were snug. Snugness isn't good in winter boots...your feet will actually be colder. So I returned for 9. I'm very happy with them. I also own an older pair of Joan of Artics from a few years ago. Those are an 8 and they fit perfect. So be warned..the sizing has changed over the years.
customer_reviews.author: S. K.

customer_reviews.title: What I was looking for
customer_reviews.text: Purchased on Amazon (seller was BackCountry, a reputable company). Bought size 8.5, my regular size is 8-8.5. I wanted to be able to wear thick socks with this. It is not quick to put on due to laces but worth it. Played in more than a foot of snow with my kids, and feet and calves well protected, dry, and warm. It is somewhat bulky, but doesn’t matter to me! Would definitely buy again!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Cute but not comfortable or warm. Caribou is still my boot!
customer_reviews.text: They were nothing like the fit of my old sorels! The were very cute and looked awesome on but I returned them. The fit was so uncomfortable I would never wear them! I was looking for a boot as functional and warm & comfortable as my caribou but a little more attractive for going out in Minnesota! There is no way that they are as warm as the Caribou! I’ll stick with what I have until I find one as great but cuter! I will always is my caribou for shoveling and dog walking! Still my favorite boot and I think they are going to last forever!
customer_reviews.author: Brooks

customer_reviews.title: Like the color (sea salt)
customer_reviews.text: I went up a half size for thick socks and they’re a tiny bit roomy but regular size would have been tight. Like the color a lot I have colorful ski wear and like white boots and hat with that combo.
customer_reviews.author: dana gamaleri

customer_reviews.title: NOT WATERPROOF
customer_reviews.text: These boots are not waterproof! I bought them to wear in the snow...since they are SNOWBOOTS. I wore them for a few hours in the snow only to realize that snow collects in the plastic seams and then melts right into the shoe. The toe and heel area were both wet when I took them off after wondering why my feet were so cold. Seriously disappointed. Also, as some reviewers mentioned, they rubbed on the back of my heels and caused a blister. I think this could be remedied by breaking them in and wearing band-aids in the meantime, but I'm sending them back because of the waterproofing issue. All I wanted was dry warm feet. NOPE
customer_reviews.author: Kris Hanna

customer_reviews.title: Pretty sure these are fakes!
customer_reviews.text: Save your money and buy from a legitimate & reputable source, just in case. These are so gigantic and bulky (and I'm not talking about the foot size, which I ordered in a 9), that I highly doubt they are real Sorels. While I don't have another pair for comparison, I will say that when I see other women with Sorel boots, they certainly don't look so cartoonishly big. It's like I'm walking in clown shoes. Mainly, it's the front rubber part - which is very, very wide (why?). Also, the stitching isn't neatly done. Which is all characteristic of something fake. That or Sorel just isn't up to my standards, especially considering the money. Too bad.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: These boots are very slippery on ice.
customer_reviews.text: I was so excited to order these, they fit as expected but I should have listened to reviews on how slippery they are. Even though they show nice tread, these boots are horrible on ice. Very disappointed in them. They look great but I bought them to walk to work in and many times the parking lot I walk across on is icy and I fell 2 times when I was not paying attention. I think if they are just for snow they would be great. Also, they are tight to put on, have to loosen the laces every time. Definitely not worth what I paid for them.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not that warm, a bit clunky. Not for long term hikes.
customer_reviews.text: First snow in the area, freezing temps but not below zero, more around 29-32. Walked around in the snow and shoveled driveway with wool socks and tights, and these boots. The boots don't keep the feet as warm as I wanted. Dry yes. Runs big in the width, might have to wear two pairs of wool socks. Looks chic as hell and great with the outfits. But if you're gonna use these for hours at a time, don't recommend. They're cute for the short snowy outting, like 2-3 hours max.
customer_reviews.author: DRN

customer_reviews.title: Please get better
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for the NYC winters. Cute, durable, warm, but slightly larger than expected - the boot is drooping down a bit behind the Achilles and digs into me. I had to stop numerous times wearing these because I get massive cuts behind my Achille's tendon / heel after walking in them for 3 miles. That's even WITH thick socks. Hoping I just need to break them in?!
customer_reviews.author: Susie Rae Fitness

customer_reviews.title: Fit For Flat Feet
customer_reviews.text: I had already ordered a half size larger for thicker socks, but unless you have very flat feet, it is hard to get your foot into the boot. I do not recommend for anyone with any kind of arch, or high foot. Otherwise, I’m sure I would have loved them, as I have loved my pair that I’ve had for 10+ years. Hopefully they will return to their original fit in the future. Us with a high instep would be grateful ☺️
customer_reviews.author: Mandi

customer_reviews.title: Cute and warm :)
customer_reviews.text: I'm very happy with these boots. They do a great job of keeping my feet warm and dry and I think they look really cute. A lot of people mentioned issues with the straps breaking, but I would point out that you should not be pulling on the straps went you're taking the boots on and off. The straps are not made for that. I find them fairly comfortable, as far as bulky winter boots go. I park about a mile away from my office, and I don't have any comfort issues walking back and forth. I wouldn't be taking them on a 10 mile hike or anything, but for your basic winter use, they're fine.
customer_reviews.author: **~Colleen~**

customer_reviews.title: Warm, waterproof, fits smaller than expected.
customer_reviews.text: The buttons, which are pretty much just decorative do come undone all the time. I’ll probably end up gluing them together. Other than that excellent boot, warm and waterproof. The fit is small as the company describes and recommends to size up. I actually had to size up more than usual. I am a size 5 1/2 in women. I sometimes go up to a size 6 particularly in winter boots with thick socks. I exchanged the 6 for a size 7.
customer_reviews.author: J. Wallace

customer_reviews.title: Work for me
customer_reviews.text: Great boots, tried them on at a local store then ordered the color I wanted. Cattail is a dark brown, very pretty. I'm usually a 9-9 1/2 and went up to a 10. If you can try them in a store I strongly suggest it. They don't have the best arch support, but it's not a deal breaker. Hopefully they keep me warm and dry on a Colorado dog sled ride!
customer_reviews.author: JBF

customer_reviews.title: My size 6-7 foot looks like a size 10!
customer_reviews.text: I’ve always wanted these Sorel boots and was so darn happy they had the color I wanted...then I got them and my happy bubble burst! I had to force my foot in the boot then once finally on (with discomfort) there was ample foot room, HOWEVER once off and when comparing my foot to the foot of the boot there was a 3” difference. It appeared as if my feet were much larger than they are - not attractive for a woman. Then when the boots wouldn’t tie tight enough to bring the faux fur lining together that was the deal breaker. It’s really too bad because I really wanted to love them. These just weren’t the boots for me.
customer_reviews.author: Tina Lewis

customer_reviews.title: After breaking in, love them
customer_reviews.text: Wore these all last winter and looking forward to wearing again this winter! The first few times I wore them, they gauged the back of my heels, like, cut and bloody, but was out and about with nothing but my niece's cloth diapers to stick in my boot to try to salvage my skin, haha. It was pretty terrible, but this is no uncommon for nearly all shoes I get until they're broken in and I should have planned for it (highly recommend Mole Skin if you have similar experiences). After they were broken in, they've been fantastic. Warm, cozy, fashionable. Looking forward to rocking them again this season.
customer_reviews.author: Suzanne

customer_reviews.title: Order a size up for socks.
customer_reviews.text: Fits true to size, if you are not planning on wearing winter socks. I ordered a full size up and thought maybe they were too big, but they work with my thick wool socks perfectly. I had a good pair of sorels in the past, that were stolen by my mother in law. I have yet to use these in the winter, but they seem of the same quality as my older sorels, which I loved. A great winter boot for heavy snow, not great on slick ice.
customer_reviews.author: Casey Cole

customer_reviews.title: Stylish, functional, warm but order a half size up!
customer_reviews.text: These boots are so stylish and very nice quality! I was in love from the moment I opened the box! I read other reviews and ordered a half size up so I could wear thick socks and glad I did! I put them to the test last night by wearing them in the rain/snow/slush with below freezing temps for about 8hrs walking and standing and my feet were dry and toasty! They were amazing boots actually. When they dried out the leather was not stained or water damaged, they look great like I just pulled them out of the box. Not only are they stylish but they work! Totally worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: SHawley

customer_reviews.title: Love These!
customer_reviews.text: They were true to size, amazing boots, very comfy and perfect for getting the tree. I need lots of arch support and these feel fantastic. They are like everyone else says though, very heavy... a heavy winter outdoor boot meant for the snow, and the cold. Although they are so stylish they'd be great for a short shopping trip too. SO happy with them!!!!! And I have a hard time finding shoes, yay!
customer_reviews.author: Adria H.

customer_reviews.title: Cute and Waterproof!
customer_reviews.text: These boots are perfect. I live in northern Wisconsin, although I'm originally from Minneapolis, MN. These boots are sturdy, supportive, warm, and most importantly...waterproof! Great for hiking through a foot of snow. Great for sloshing through dirty city mud puddles. They come up to about mid-calf on me. I ordered a size up so that there's room for thick socks, and I'm glad I did that. I love these boots so much.
customer_reviews.author: Bradley

customer_reviews.title: Boot Not for COLD weather!
customer_reviews.text: This is advertised as a boot for cold weather, I disagree! This is not for women who spend time outdoors working or leisure activities in temperatures below 20 degrees above zero. The bottom of the boots are so think you can feel gravel through the sole of the boot as you walk. The felt liner, though removeable is very thin and substandard for Sorel. The boot is large enough for 2 pairs of wool socks to make up for warmth where the boot is lacking. I’m very disappointed in this Sorel product.
customer_reviews.author: Phyllis Brotten

customer_reviews.title: So happy with these boots!
customer_reviews.text: Love these boots! I've been wanting to get them for a while, and finally saw a great sale so I went for it and so glad I did. I got my normal shoe size and they fit great, with or without thick socks. You really can get away with normal socks though, these are so warm! I tramped through a foot of snow in these and didn't feel a slight chill. Really happy I went with the taller sorel style also - I mean I seriously walked through a foot of snow with no moisture attacking me. Get these boots!
customer_reviews.author: Abby

customer_reviews.title: Love these boots! Very warm and stylish!
customer_reviews.text: I wear a 12 wide and ordered a 12 and they fit me comfortably. they are very warm and keep my feet dry. I would highly recommend these boots! I have fibromyalgia and have trouble with my feet but have not noticed a problem with the arch support. I rated them is a little wider than normal because they fit me. They would probably fit somebody with a medium with foot as well.
customer_reviews.author: BBP Household

customer_reviews.title: Once was a great product, in the past now!
customer_reviews.text: the fit was very tight. I usually wear 7 or 7.5 but I ordered an 8 to be safe. They were very tight across the top of the foot near the ankle and down the side. The excessive use of glue has China written all over it. I understand the original company went under and they were bought out by Columbia; but to shut down and move to where the profits are huge and quality is minimal was wrong. Sorry you cannot make an inferior product for pennies and sell it back here for big bucks.
customer_reviews.author: lemawa

customer_reviews.title: Wow- I can’t describe how much I love these boots
customer_reviews.text: Wow- I can’t describe how much I love these boots!! Fit is perfect, they are very cute. I have wide feet and the women’s 8.5 fit me perfectly. Just follow the company’s directions for measuring your foot before ordering. I suppose for women with very large calves these boots could be too tight, but for someone with an average build, they will be wonderful. Construction is really sturdy and the leather is real. I haven’t tested them in wet anow for waterproofness yet. Fingers crossed they are as waterproof as the say they are!
customer_reviews.author: Yan Izquierdo

customer_reviews.title: What I ordered, exact sizing.
customer_reviews.text: Love the boots! Exactly what I ordered. As for sizing, I ordered my regular size. At first I thought maybe imthey were too small about after wearing them around, my true size was good. They are not flexible shoes so it is different walking in them. A half size up my foot would have been moving too much. I wear them with regular socks.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Winter Boots
customer_reviews.text: The Joan of Arctic boots have a reputation for a reason- they are amazingly warm and waterproof. I have wore them skiing, dog sledding, to walk around in the Chicago winter and have never ever had cold toes. I finally pulled the trigger after seeing them (slightly) on sale here on Amazon and they are 100% worth it. They are quite stiff at first (kinda feels like you're wearing a medical boot?), but I wore them around the house and to take the dog out the week before my ski trip and they were broken in very quickly. A+
customer_reviews.author: Erika A

customer_reviews.title: Love these but run small
customer_reviews.text: Love these but run small! I am size 8m - 8.5. I bought 8.5 and they were to small and when I did manage to pull them on finally they hurt! I I ordered a size 9 (which I have never worn before) and hoping they fit! And I have to pay a return fee even though KI am a prime member and have been for 20 years!
customer_reviews.author: cynthia nathan

customer_reviews.title: Well worth every penny
customer_reviews.text: We like warm boots And it’s been hard to find good boots to keep feet warm in north country Our temps already been in the teens . And my daughter said nicest comfortable and warmest boots she ever had . I’ve bought her muck artic sports that we all buy for winter and she said these are even warmer . Got to 5 star it if they are better than a muck boot . Shoe laces pretty gaudy but with new brown laces they look great
customer_reviews.author: Roxanne grant

customer_reviews.title: Not great if you have a high instep
customer_reviews.text: I really really wanted to like these. I've been looking for warm boots that were waterproof, too. They were hard to get on due to my high instep. Then, they rubbed across the instep once I did get them on. Beyond that, the sole felt thinner than I had expected. I could feel a bit too much through the bottom of the shoe--not what I was expecting from these. So, returning them. The three stars are for the styling and finish. Very nice. Just not functional for me.
customer_reviews.author: Boot girl

customer_reviews.title: Love everything about these boots
customer_reviews.text: Love everything about these boots! They are so warm and comfy! I normally wear a size 8 but I got an 8.5 to be safe and they fit perfectly with thick socks! Just enough room to wiggle my toes and walk comfortably. They are a bit heavy and clunky, but that is to be expected with a nice warm winter boot! Beautiful boots!
customer_reviews.author: Irie

customer_reviews.title: Warm, dry and cute
customer_reviews.text: Read numerous reviews, even went to DSW (tried on the black Sorel Joan of Arc) and caribou. Preferred the look of the Joan of Arc. I am true 10, but always, always cold, especially my feet. The 11 slipped a bit, 10.5 fit with wool, thicker socks, thin socks fit fine. Love the color and hint of pink. They are bulkier (like the old duck boots), not heavy. Kept my feet warm and dry and that's what I wanted.
customer_reviews.author: M. Swartz

customer_reviews.title: Good boots but not the quality I had hoped for!!
customer_reviews.text: editing my review due to poor quality.. I can’t believe with a name like “Sorel” the quality is so poor. I have read a few other reviews stating the snaps broke off the lining. I figured I’d give it a try and I’m sorry I did. I ordered a 1/2 size bigger and they fit good definitely waterproof and warm. I’m so disappointed because I did like these. But the price you pay you best I’m starting a return on these
customer_reviews.author: Del13

customer_reviews.title: I wanted to like these boots...
customer_reviews.text: I’ve wanted a pair of Sorels for a really long time, and went for it when there was a decent price for them on Amazon. But when I put them on my feet, they felt clunky and big. They’re not at all flexible; it felt like wearing flippers. They also rubbed on the back of my heels really badly, giving me cuts. And when i took them off, the entire insert came out with my feet. I have to return them....
customer_reviews.author: Cassie Willett

customer_reviews.title: True to size, meant for snow and cold weather
customer_reviews.text: Order your true size (sizing up will leave too much room in the toe area and the arch will be off which causes these boots to be uncomfortable to walk in)! You do have to loosen the laces to get your foot in but it’s worth it to have them fit correct! Love these boots for true cold weather days& the lining comes out easily and will help them dry faster if you’re out in bad weather. Worth the splurge. Replacing my 10 year old pair for a color update.
customer_reviews.author: Carly

customer_reviews.title: Great boot
customer_reviews.text: Sent these boots to my daughter who lives in Omaha, Neb. She said they are great. Have kept her feet warm and dry. She has been wearing them everyday this past week for 3-5 hours at a time, very comfortable. She has them tied so she can slip them on and off easily also. The fur around top will shed if you pull on it, but not by normal wear.
customer_reviews.author: Carrie Border

customer_reviews.title: Cute and do the job
customer_reviews.text: These were a gift for my girlfriend and she loves them. They keep her feet nice and warm and are very comfortable. On slippery surfaces they were stable and with all they look good too. Only complaint is they are heavy but that is understandable since they are boots.
customer_reviews.author: Nathan R Castoldi

customer_reviews.title: Quality boot - runs a little small.
customer_reviews.text: These are really nice boots, as expected from Sorel. They do run a half size smaller than they did 20 years ago. I hope they last as well as my 20+ Sorels I still do horse chores in all winter.
customer_reviews.author: Cisco's human

customer_reviews.title: Wanted to love them
customer_reviews.text: These boots are beautiful. I was so disappointed they didn’t work for me. I ordered the size a normally wear. It was almost impossible to get them on even with a good shoe horn. Once I got my foot in they are way to big with heavy rubbing on the heal. Had to return them.
customer_reviews.author: shauna

customer_reviews.title: B+
customer_reviews.text: I love these boots! So cute and warm for the long Minnesota winters. The only downside so far is that the right one is literally murdering my ankle... and thus the reason for only 3 stars. The inside of the boot has rubbed my ankle raw. Hoping that I just need to break them in more, but odd that it doesn’t happen with the left boot.
customer_reviews.author: Etowngurl143

customer_reviews.title: WARM, STURDY AND WARM
customer_reviews.text: I love my Sorel boots. I get compliments on them wherever I go. They are very fashionable and functional. The only thing I don't like is how difficult they are to get off. I feel like I cannot remove these without help and have had to enlist my husband's assistance. Maybe after I break them in more they will not be so difficult to remove.
customer_reviews.author: Sandy

customer_reviews.title: Perfect fit/do not size up.
customer_reviews.text: Love Sorels! I have a short boot that fits below my calf that works wonders in rainy and cold weather. They are my go to boots when the weather is just plain nasty. We gave a CO trip coming up and I am STOKED to wear these babies out there! I wanted a higher fitting boot for snow coverage since NC does not get nearly as much snow as CO. And these boots fit perfectly. I debated going up half a size, but stuck with my normal 9 and I can still fit my foot comfortably with a heavy wool sock on. By far the best brand of boot I have found to this day.
customer_reviews.author: Justin Fletcher

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: I'd had my eye on these for years and jumped at purchasing these with the steep discount. I sized up by half a size as suggested in so many reviews and this was the right call. Sadly, walking just a few steps proved to be a painful experience. In the area between the heel and Achilles tendon the boot bends very sharply. This would make walking even short distances pure torture. Really disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: Jules

customer_reviews.title: Don't rush to opinion on first trying on... break them in.
customer_reviews.text: When they first arrived they felt really tight, but after wearing them out a couple days they broke in. They are so warm and so comfortable! Break them in before deciding to size up. I wore them to the Sapporo Snow Festival (Japan). Four days of walking around and they were great! I love them and will definitely be buying again in the future when needed.
customer_reviews.author: caitlin

customer_reviews.title: overall happy with purchase
customer_reviews.text: i did a lot of shopping around looking for the right boots for snow and finally landed with these. overall im happy with my purchase, they're cute and stylish but also comfy and decently warm. only critique would be they're a little bulky, they don't have the best grip in the world if it's really icy, and you'e still going to need foot warmies if it's below 20 degrees.
customer_reviews.author: Jordan Mogen

customer_reviews.title: Love these boots!!
customer_reviews.text: I love these boots so much. They were perfect for the cold Montana weather. What I found out after my purchase is that it’s better to buy a half size bigger so that you can wear extra thick socks or two pairs of socks. I wish I had know that. But honestly I love them and they are stylish. And the fact that the inserts come out so you can wash or replace is great.
customer_reviews.author: SebastianPhoto

customer_reviews.title: Uncomfortable
customer_reviews.text: I tried these in three different sizes and styles, all of them fit poorly and were uncomfortable, particularly in the ankle area. The bits of leather to which the lace rings are attached rub against my ankle bones, my heels slip if the fit isn't just right. I wanted these to fit as they are super cute, but they simply aren't comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Soybert

customer_reviews.title: I needed these for extreme conditions, and they were perfect!
customer_reviews.text: I was VERY nervous to buy these without trying them on, but they were perfect. I wear a 10, but knew I would be wearing thick socks, so I went up half a size. I read in other reviews not to pull on the little tabs to pull the boots on, so they're holding up well. I needed these for an outdoor festival in Aspen, and the snow was 3 feet deep in places. My feet were warm and dry the whole time, thank goodness. They are really cute, too - I am very happy with my purchase!!
customer_reviews.author: wanderingsun

customer_reviews.title: Love these boots!
customer_reviews.text: These boots were exactly what I was expecting. Even though I was a bit nervous about sizing and if they would come damaged. But they are excellent! I can even wear a thick sock with them and it be perfect! I ordered the Oatmeal boot and I have gotten many compliments. Wore them to a COLD KC Chiefs game and my toes felt great the whole game! Great price, and prime two-day shipping works with this item! GREAT PURCHASE.
customer_reviews.author: Taryn Margaret

customer_reviews.title: Run small
customer_reviews.text: These boots run small. Ordered for fiance, she's in the smaller side of a size 9 usually... These barely went over her foot (and it took both of us to accomplish that feat). We guessed they are about a full size to small. Label indicated the size we'd ordered (10) but compared to other boots the sole appeared shorter.
customer_reviews.author: DarkPsonic

customer_reviews.title: Love these. Warm and comfortable
customer_reviews.text: Love these. Warm and comfortable. I wore these on our recent ski trip to Breckenridge. Due to lack of parking, we did a lot of walking when we were not on the slopes. They kept my feet warm and dry and almost as comfortable as my ugg boots. I wear a 6.5 and bought a 7 and they fit great with thicker socks. Very cute too!
customer_reviews.author: G. Daniel

customer_reviews.title: Hard to get on
customer_reviews.text: Somehow these were both difficult to put on, yet left my foot sloshing around the inside. Pull tabs are just for show.
customer_reviews.author: Laura Bridges

customer_reviews.title: Great quality and looks very smart.
customer_reviews.text: Perfect fit. Looks great and super warm. Served me well in Japan in - 30 degree celcius temperatures. Never had cold feet the whole time and could walk in these for hours. They're super comfortable. The best thing I love about these boots (apart from the look) is that they lace up SO EASILY! Buy them. You won't regret it!
customer_reviews.author: Colleen

customer_reviews.title: Happy customer
customer_reviews.text: Hard to walk in. Stiff and difficult for a heel toe gait pattern. Maybe that will get better with more wear. Great quality and love how they look. My feet stayed warm when at the ice castles. Happy with purchase
customer_reviews.author: Dessa

customer_reviews.title: They live up to their creed.
customer_reviews.text: I am wearing these boot in Alaska, temperatures oscillating around14 to -4 F (-10 to -20Celcius). So far so good. They are a bit tight, but they are warm. I would say they do run a bit small, so if you are planing to use thick or wool socks order one size up.
customer_reviews.author: Angelica Butler

customer_reviews.title: Size just right
customer_reviews.text: Super comfy and warm. I was on the fence about ordering an 11 or a 10 because although I am a solid 11, I've been a 10 in previous versions of the Joan of Arctic boots. I can say that if you are solidly one size, go with that size or a half size up if you want extra wiggle room!
customer_reviews.author: A-lee

customer_reviews.title: Warm
customer_reviews.text: These are very comfortable and warm. They keep my feet dry. They can be a little heavy, but they’re boots, not tennis shoes. I’ve had these four years and they still look like they’re in perfect condition.
customer_reviews.author: Rachel

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful boot but...
customer_reviews.text: This is a beautiful boot but they seem to be made for Fred Flintstone. If you have a narrow foot, not a great fit and going smaller is just as wide, only shorter. They are wide from heel to toe, not just at the toe box. I have another pair of Sorel boots that I love and that aren't wide like this particular style.
customer_reviews.author: Avid Shopper

customer_reviews.title: Boots are cute and fit well
customer_reviews.text: These boots are cuter, comfortable and they fit nicely. However, the bottoms of the soles are not made for winter, I almost slipped on snow the first time I wore them, they have zero traction. I've bought sorrells before and loved them so I decided to splurge and buy a new pair but I was very disappointed that these didnt have good traction like my old ones did
customer_reviews.author: Jillian

customer_reviews.title: Sorel does not disappoint.
customer_reviews.text: These boots fit just perfectly with winter socks! If wearing a thin sock they may be a bit big. And they are just a gorgeous boot...leave it to Sorel. Because the upper is suede I had to waterproof them with silicone spray. As soon as it snows I’ll see if it worked. I have been wanting a pair of these for years and I am not disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: rudytudy

customer_reviews.title: They are the best!
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for boots with good grip. Ever since I had major back surgery ten years ago being in icy conditions freaks me out. I read other reviews that said these boots were good in icy conditions so I bought them. I was not disappointed! Plus they are very comfortable and good looking. I highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Chere Newell

customer_reviews.title: definitely recommend
customer_reviews.text: My shoe size is 8.5 and that's the size I purchased. These boots are a tiny bit big but I would not size up -- it allows for thick socks without pinching your feet (which makes you colder!). My feet are constantly cold and only after 1.5 hours of standing in snow do my feet get cold in these boots. Highly recommend Sorel brand!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Best choice for outdoor winter footwear
customer_reviews.text: These are the best winter boots I've ever owned! I'm one of those people whose feet are always cold. Even if I'm out for 1/2 hour in snow or low temperatures, my toes get numb. In these boots, my feet stayed warm the entire time I wore them. For the first time ever, I actually enjoy being out in the cold. I found that the size ran small so even though I wear an 8 1/2 usually, I had to order a size 10, which fit perfectly. I had some trouble ordering through the company but apart from that negative experience I would 100% recommend these boots.
customer_reviews.author: Terry Evanson

customer_reviews.title: Awesome snow boots
customer_reviews.text: Awesome snow boots. I tried on several different Joan of Arctics before I found these that fit and feel just right. Not sure what that is. Same size just different color. These black ones are softer and don't have that thing in the back of your ankle that digs in like others have noted in their reviews. You can kind of see it in the picture. The ones that really go in at the ankle in the back have that weird spot but these do not and they are fantastic!
customer_reviews.author: fan

customer_reviews.title: I am happy with the warmth and waterproof quality
customer_reviews.text: Had a warm winter so just got to wearing these today. I am happy with the warmth and waterproof quality, but they are pretty darn heavy. Worth it if they keep me warm though, and the severe weather hasn't hit yet. They cut into my right calf and hoping they will "break in." And finally, the pull tabs are on snaps that attach to the felt insert and the boot itself, and the snaps keep popping open, so really wish they went with a better quality snap. Wish the pull tab was only on the boot and not the insert, as I also fear the felt will tear in time. Will update when I have to walk on ice.
customer_reviews.author: Eileen Corcoran

customer_reviews.title: Great boots - tricky sizing
customer_reviews.text: Love these boots. I previously had the Sorel Tofino boots, and while these are definitely wider and heavier - they are quite a bit warmer. Perfect for MN winters. I read some reviews that said the boot and/or liner ran small, so I ordered a 9. I'm typically between 8.5 and 9, and after a few wears I'm wishing I had gone with the 8.5. The 9 will be great with thick socks, but since the boots are so warm I'm not sure I'll have to wear thick socks with them often. Still love them, but next time I will go with the smaller size.
customer_reviews.author: mspmama13

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: so comfy! The only thing that bothers me is that the tabs on the top of the boot - meant for pulling on your boots - are snaps- so totally not usable for pulling your boots on because they become unsnapped - also these boots seem and look like winter boots - and for the most part they do the job - but the tread on the bottom are horrible for walking back indoors on title or anything no grip slip whatsoever
customer_reviews.author: ashley

customer_reviews.title: Not for people with flat feet. Heavy and not comfortable to walk in.
customer_reviews.text: These boots are heavy duty and surprisingly cute but they hurt my arches after walking around in the house for 10 minutes. I can't review how warm or waterproof they are because I didn't wear them outside. They just weren't comfortable for my to walk in so I couldn't keep them. I tried to give them to my sister who has a high arch, thinking they would be more comfortable for her, but she couldn't even get her foot in them. I kept the other sorels I ordered at the same time and I love them.
customer_reviews.author: Morgan Kilday

customer_reviews.title: My sister feels her a little heavy for her
customer_reviews.text: My sister had me order these for her she loves the color and the fit. My sister is a little older and feels that they’re a little heavy for her not sure she will keep them on that reason alone.
customer_reviews.author: PK  Tolar

customer_reviews.title: Sorel Women's Joan Of Arctic Boot
customer_reviews.text: Love the way they look! Beautiful. Fit is perfect. Have worn them out walking the dog and they are very comfortable and warm. Have not yet tested in the snow. Have read a couple reviews that peoples toes get cold in these boots but others LOVE them and say there very warm. Anxious to get some snow so I can find out for myself. So far, LOVE THEM!
customer_reviews.author: LL

customer_reviews.title: Say goodbye to cold, wet feet wl these boots
customer_reviews.text: I was tired of walking around with freezing cold wet feet in my previous pair of booths. So after getting to my desk and clocking in, taking off my boots to dry out and to dry my socks more quickly, I ordered these boots to save my feet. Say goodbye to wet cold feet with these booths. For the remaining months of winter my feet were warm and dry. I should have ordered them sooner.
customer_reviews.author: Lauren

customer_reviews.title: I would recommend.
customer_reviews.text: My wife loves these. I had a hard time locating these in my wife's normal size; 11 (Womens). When my wife finally tried them on they were too tight, even with an ordinary sock. I returned them for a 12 which provides the perfect fit with a thick, wool sock. I took the liberty of ordering paracord in multiple different colors and making her extra shoe laces. She loves them!
customer_reviews.author: T. P.

customer_reviews.title: Not comfortable
customer_reviews.text: I like this color, But when I open the box, the first feeling Was the shoes very old, I usually wearing size 8, but this shoes the size goes smaller. Very hard to fit in my feet, a little bit narrow on toes area. Not comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Kathy Zhou

customer_reviews.title: Lifetime purchase? I can’t wear these another day. Forget a lifetime.
customer_reviews.text: During my first timely wear I was in so much pain. I ran home and took them off. Yes my feet were warm and dry for also bleeding and swollen. The part around the heel and ankle had scraped against my ankles removing skin. I’m returning them. I’ve heard they are amazing boots but not for me.
customer_reviews.author: Sara M Ashton

customer_reviews.title: Super cute boot!
customer_reviews.text: Super cute... Love them... Only issue it's hard to get on and off around your ankle... The boot is so solid it doesn't give... So you have to force your door into it... Once it's in... You are set... But it's like a ski boot almost when you try to get your foot in it. Otherwise no complaints so far...
customer_reviews.author: Natalie R.

customer_reviews.title: Very nice boots. They do rub in the back across ...
customer_reviews.text: Very nice boots. They do rub in the back across the ankle and they are stiff to walk in. They don't bend well in the back and this causing the rubbing along with the seams being very thick. Thick socks help! Three years later they are still like new and still rubbing and not bending well to walk in. I can't wear them for long periods of time.
customer_reviews.author: Gina

customer_reviews.title: They are not warm
customer_reviews.text: I'm typically a size 6. I couldn't get my foot in due to the tight heel. I exchanged for size 7. Still difficult to get foot in. When I walk they feel too big and clunky. I bought Sorel because reviews say they're the best for warmth and keeping feet dry. My feet stay COLD and dry.
customer_reviews.author: Candice

customer_reviews.title: Sorel doesn’t fit for me.
customer_reviews.text: I had to return the boots as they did not fit. I wear a 9 M boot which I ordered but it was so narrow I could not get my foot in either boot. I gave them 3 stars because the boots are well made and it was an efficient & easy return. I guess Sorel boots aren’t for me.
customer_reviews.author: CT resident

customer_reviews.title: Love these boots!
customer_reviews.text: I have wanted these boots for a long time and got a great deal on Amazon. They are cute and comfortable. I hate winter but I’m looking forward to being able to wear these boots!
customer_reviews.author: Jessica

customer_reviews.title: Obsessed
customer_reviews.text: I am completely obsessed with these boots! Perfect mix of colors, super warm and kept my feet dry while skiing. Some reviewers said they weren’t fashionable but I highly disagree. Definitely cute enough to wear out on a snowy day. I typically wear an 8.5 so I bought a 9 as I wanted room for heavy socks. Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: @Riarichxo

customer_reviews.title: Worth the price!
customer_reviews.text: These boots are definitely worth the money. It was -38 (that’s not counting the windchill) on Jan 1st 2017z It was the coldest temp on the world for that day (random fact). We had to travel and my feet were still toasty warm. I’m impressed plus they are really cute. If you live somewhere with extreme cold or a lot of snow don’t hesitate to buy based on the price.
customer_reviews.author: Nin Nin

customer_reviews.title: Great  Purchase
customer_reviews.text: I get cold feet all the time. When we planned a ski trip to Breckinridge I knew I would be miserable. I did a lot of research to find boots that would keep my feet warm. These boots were amazing. They are comfortable and very warm while walking a lot in the snow and Ice. While not cheap they were worth every penny plus more.
customer_reviews.author: Kim

customer_reviews.title: Bulky but warm, comfortable and perfect for harsh winters
customer_reviews.text: These are so warm and cute. They look great with almost anything and you won't slide around on snow and ice in these. They're true to size. I wear an 8. That's what I bought and they're perfect and fit warm socks underneath. They are heavy and bulky though and don't fit like other boots. They feel like ski boots but that's what I expected.
customer_reviews.author: Faten N. Dabis

customer_reviews.title: Definitely order a half size up.
customer_reviews.text: I did as others suggested and ordered these boots a half size up, which I was happy about. The downside is they are unusually wide, but according to what I've read, that helps with insulation. I loved wearing them and they are so cute. I can't wait to wear them again! I hiked with them and they were pretty supportive, but it's not suggested for that kind of use. Mainly stick to wearing them on less adventurous days.
customer_reviews.author: Ted

customer_reviews.title: great boots
customer_reviews.text: Great boots. only issue i have w/ them is that they were HUGELY difficult to squeeze my feet into. i have particularly narrow feet, so i'm surprised, but it could be that they need to stretch out over time (i've only used them twice). will leave it at 5 stars for now, as they work exactly as advertised. kept my feet warm and dry through a recent nor'easter.
customer_reviews.author: Ek

customer_reviews.title: SHADY
customer_reviews.text: Product was shipped with discoloration and a mildew smell. Shipped back for refund. Sellers address on return label says UK. When you talk to the seller they say they're located in Northern Ireland. Very shady and I'm out 260.00 bucks
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very pretty..
customer_reviews.text: The foot was to large the calf was to tight and I'm a small person with skinny legs I sized up as recommended from 8.5 to 9 but the foot was huge....with skinny skinny calf, had a good laugh I couldn't get them off my husband had to pull them off....but the worst was the weight they put over two pounds on each foot...sent them back ....they were pretty though.
customer_reviews.author: NJ

customer_reviews.title: LOVE Sorel's!
customer_reviews.text: LOVE Sorel's!!! My second pair since 1998, the last one's I got rid of only because I wanted an updated pair. Feet are warm, and it's been -27 here a lot lately! Have worked great in deep snow. I make sure I can wiggle my toes really good so that air can get around and help my feet stay warm. I also wear wool socks when I am going to be out in the cold with these for awhile, that or no socks at all. Keeps my feet warmer then wearing cotton ones. They are beautiful and I have gotten lots of comments on them.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great quality but very difficult to put on
customer_reviews.text: The quality on these boots are amazing. I’m not giving 5 stars because these are a very tight fit. I’m a true 8 1/2, always have been and I don’t have wide feet. These are very hard to get on and off and I’m wishing I wouldn’t have worn them out and exchanged them for a 9. My suggestion is to order a half size up.
customer_reviews.author: Aly

customer_reviews.title: Not comfortable
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to love these - for snowy, cold climates they are the perfect boot - except for the way that they fit. They run very large, and feel extremely heavy and clunky when on. Not ideal for hiking all day as far as comfort, although great if you want a super warm, waterproof boot and don't mind the bulk - I really wish they fit better.
customer_reviews.author: zenmama

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable!
customer_reviews.text: I really am happy with these boots. They are really comfortable! The temperatures haven’t been really cold yet to put them to the test. But I can say they’re comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: J M.

customer_reviews.title: Warmth!
customer_reviews.text: These boots are super cute and keep my feet dry and toasty. I couldn’t ask for a better winter boot. I have big, wide feet but that was not a problem at all in these boots. I have room for thick socks and can lace them up tight to my calves. Love!
customer_reviews.author: Sarah Kay

customer_reviews.title: Pros: warm, comfy, well-made. Con: heavy
customer_reviews.text: Read quite a few reviews about the size running large and boot cutting into the heel, but I am a size 8 with a slightly wide foot and prominent heel, and the 8 fit perfectly with enough room for the toes and no chaffing/blistering. They keep my feet extremely warm and dry. The vivid blue fur stands out among other women in ‘bootus genericus.’ Giving 4 stars as they clonk at first and are physically heavier than any boot I have ever worn, which takes some getting used to.
customer_reviews.author: SnazzyGal

customer_reviews.title: Great boot, but runs small
customer_reviews.text: Good boot. I knew it would feel large on the foot. That is the style of this shoe. However, they run small. I would recommend going a full size larger. I wear a 10 ladies and bought the 10.5.
customer_reviews.author: Martin Witt III

customer_reviews.title: Wife loves them
customer_reviews.text: These are one of my wife’s favorite pairs of snow boots! They are a little bigger then expected but it’s fine if she wears thick socks!
customer_reviews.author: Dylan

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful and warm
customer_reviews.text: This is my first pair of Sorel boots. They are really warm - I will not be wearing these in Florida! I bought them for a trip to Whistler in the winter and I can tell they are going to keep my feet very warm - in addition to being really stylish. They're heavy, great quality (and beautiful) boots.
customer_reviews.author: Karen E. Kaiser

product_meta.title: SOREL - Women's Joan of Arctic Waterproof Insulated Winter Boot
feature_bullets: READY FOR WINTER: A serious snow boot with serious style; Chic lace-up style with faux fur cuff perfect for your winter wardrobe
WATERPROOF BOOT: Made with waterproof suede and features a seam-sealed waterproof construction; Keeps your feet happy, dry and protected in any weather
ALL-DAY WARMTH AND COMFORT: Features a removable 6 mm washable recycled felt inner boot for extra warmth; 2.5 mm bonded felt frost plug in the midsole provides extra insulation
DURABLE CONSTRUCTION: Handcrafted waterproof vulcanized rubber shell with herringbone outsole provides extra grip that keeps your feet on the ground
FUNCTION MEETS FASHION: SOREL creates bold, always-ready footwear that's built to take on non-stop days and nights in the city
